contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=June 2011}} {{notability|date=June 2011}} {{Infobox Television episode | Title = Epiphanies | Series = Babylon 5 | Image = [[Image:B5 Epiphanies 1.jpg|256px]] | Caption = | Season = 4 | Episode = 7 | Airdate = 10 February 1997 | Production = 407 | Writer = [[J. Michael Straczynski]] | Director = [[John Flinn, III]] | Guests = [[Damian London]] (Minister)<br>[[Walter Koenig]] (Bester) | Episode list = [[List of Babylon 5 episodes|List of ''Babylon 5'' episodes]] | Prev = [[Into the Fire (Babylon 5)|Into the Fire]] | Next = [[The Illusion of Truth]] }} "'''Epiphanies'''" is an episode from the fourth season of the science-fiction television series ''[[Babylon 5]]''. ==Synopsis== [[Michael Garibaldi|Garibaldi]] resigns his position. Bester returns with news of Earth Alliance plans to isolate and discredit Babylon 5. ==Arc significance== * Psi Corps and President Clark launch a new offensive aimed at isolating Babylon 5. * Garibaldi resigns as Chief of Security. * Bester betrays the Psi Corps to help Sheridan retrieve technology from Z'ha'dum that could free his lover from the Shadow technology. * Z'ha'dum has been destroyed by defense systems set off by Lyta Alexander to prevent Bester from getting his hands on Shadow technology. * Some of the Shadows' "servants" fled Z'ha'dum before the destruction of the planet. * The Centauri Regent has a [[Drakh#Keepers|keeper]]. ==Quote== <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Epiph5.jpg|300px|thumb|right|A [[Starfury]] starting a fly-by of the [[Babylon 5]]-station]] --> "I have seen what power does, and I have seen what power costs. The one is never equal to the other." -- G'Kar to Franklin ==External links== * [http://www.midwinter.com/lurk/guide/073.html Epiphanies] at ''[[The Lurker's Guide to Babylon 5]]'' {{B5|cent=yes}} {{Babylon 5 S4}} [[Category:Babylon 5 (season 4) episodes]] [[Category:1997 television episodes]] {{babylon5-stub}} [[ru:Прозрение (Вавилон-5)]]
